title: Lemon-Tahini Roasted Cauliflower Bowl
description: A bright, savory bowl featuring caramelized roasted cauliflower tossed with a creamy lemon-tahini dressing, crunchy toasted chickpeas, and fresh herbs. Easy sheet-pan roasting and simple assembly make this a vibrant plant-forward meal with tangy, nutty, and herbaceous flavors.

ingredients.notes: trim core and cut into bite-sized florets

ingredients.display_name: plain dairy-free yogurt or regular yogurt (for creamier bowl, optional)
ingredients.notes: use plain coconut or almond yogurt for vegan option

ingredients.display_name: toasted sesame seeds or chopped toasted almonds (for garnish)

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). Line two rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper for even roasting.
Toss the cauliflower florets with half the olive oil, ground cumin, smoked paprika, half the salt, and half the pepper in a large bowl until evenly coated.
Spread the cauliflower in a single layer on one prepared baking sheet, leaving space between pieces for browning.
On the second baking sheet, toss the rinsed and dried chickpeas with the remaining olive oil, remaining salt, remaining pepper and optional red pepper flakes, then spread in a single layer.

Roast both sheets in the preheated oven: roast the cauliflower for 25-30 minutes until deep golden and tender, and roast the chickpeas for 20-25 minutes until crisp, turning the chickpeas once halfway through. Remove chickpeas when crisp and continue to roast cauliflower if needed.

While the vegetables roast, make the lemon-tahini dressing by whisking together tahini, fresh lemon juice, minced garlic, warm water, and a pinch of salt until smooth and pourable. Taste and adjust with more water or lemon as desired.
If using yogurt for a creamier bowl, stir yogurt into a small bowl and fold in a couple tablespoons of the tahini dressing to loosen and flavor it.

When cauliflower is roasted, transfer to a large mixing bowl, add half of the chopped parsley and toss with about half of the lemon-tahini dressing to coat. Adjust seasoning with more salt, pepper or lemon if needed.

Assemble bowls by dividing dressed cauliflower among bowls, topping with roasted chickpeas, a drizzle of remaining tahini dressing, spoonfuls of yogurt if using, chopped parsley and cilantro, toasted sesame seeds or almonds, and lemon zest.
Serve immediately while chickpeas are still crisp, or cool to room temperature for meal prep; store leftovers in airtight containers in the refrigerator up to 3 days.
